meanings.definition: Done or acting according to a fixed plan or system.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a systematic approach to conduct the experiment.
meanings.sent2: She followed a systematic process to organize her study materials.
meanings.sent3: The systematic arrangement of books on the shelf made it easy to find a specific one.
meanings.sent4: His systematic way of solving puzzles amazed everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The systematic ticking of the clock echoed through the room, marking each passing second.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's systematic way of teaching helped students understand complex topics.
meanings.sent2: The garden was a systematic display of colorful flowers in perfect rows.
meanings.sent3: The systematic arrangement of ingredients made cooking the recipe a breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her systematic approach to cleaning the house left every corner spotless.
meanings.sent5: The systematic pattern of stars in the night sky created a mesmerizing view.

meanings.definition: Relating to or involving a system.
meanings.sent1: The company implemented a systematic software to manage their inventory.
meanings.sent2: The new law brought about systematic changes in the taxation system.
meanings.sent3: The systematic upgrade of the computer network improved its overall performance.
meanings.sent4: Her systematic analysis of data revealed interesting patterns.
meanings.sent5: The systematic structure of the building ensured efficient use of space.
